column1: Question: Find all values of $k$ so that the domain of_x000D_
\[b(x) = \frac{kx^2 + 2x - 5}{-5x^2 + 2x + k}\]is the set of all real numbers.
The domain of b(x) is all real numbers if and only if the denominator is never zero for any real x. In other words, the quadratic equation
A quadratic equation ax² + bx + c = 0 has no real solutions when its discriminant D = b² – 4ac is negative.
For our denominator, a = –5, b = 2, and c = k. So the discriminant is
Thus, for any value of k less than –1/5, the denominator –5x² + 2x + k will never equal zero, and the function b(x) will be defined for all real numbers.
Therefore, the answer is all k such that k < –1/5.
